2:
For he comforts himself,
\q thinking that his sin will not be discovered and be hated.
7:
How precious is your covenant faithfulness, God!
\q Humanity takes refuge under the shadow of your wings.
\q
9:
For with you is the fountain of life;
\q in your light we will see light.
10:
Extend your covenant faithfulness fully to those who know you,
\q your defense to the upright of heart.
\q
11:
Do not let the foot of the arrogant man come near to me.
\q Do not let the hand of the wicked drive me away.
\q
12:
Over there the evildoers have fallen;
\q they are knocked down and are not able to get up.
36:
\m
\d For the chief musician. A psalm of David the servant of Yahweh.
\q
